title.narrative: Provision of life saving emergency shelter support and non food items to conflict affected populations in Borno State

description.narrative:
The proposed 8 months project aims at procuring, prepositioning and distributing emergency shelters, emergency shelter reinforcement kits and comprehensive NFI kits. The response will increase the ability to respond to emergency needs of highly vulnerable populations where access is intermittent and where flooding, disease outbreaks, or new displacements take place in line with NHF allocation strategy. In particular it will promote the safety and dignity of families affected by conflict by pursuing the following outputs: 1) The most vulnerable IDPs, returnees and host community members have access to emergency shelters meeting minimum requirements 2) The most vulnerable IDPs, returnees and members of host community have access to reinforced shelter rehabilitation assistance 3) Vulnerable IDPs, retunees and host community members have access to critical life-saving non-food items. ACTED proposes to focus on Mafa LGA (2 informal sites registered in the DTM - mafa primary school camp government girls secondary school - 6 wards registered in the DTM - Ajari Bulamari Hausari Govt lodge Wulari Tukuleri - as well as other locations where need may arise) where it will upgrade makeshift shelters through the shelter reinforcement kits or if required and the makeshift shelter are irreparably damaged will provide new Dikwa emergency shelters as well as NFI kits.
ACTED proposes to procure the relevant relief items and respond to existing needs immediately after finalization of the procurement process keeping a certain number of kits on stock as emergency reserve for emergency needs caused by weather extremes such as flooding and new influx of IDPs or returnees.
This project will use a mobile team approach which will enable a flexible approach that can respond quickly to rapidly changing situations and provide services where gaps exist. The intervention will target 14400 IDPs, returnees and host community members. ACTED anticipated a target ratio of 50 percent IDPs, 40% returnees and 10% most vulnerable host communities to avoid contributing to communal tensions. A total of 1600 NFI kits will be distributed, 400 shelter reinforcement kits and 500 emergency shelters of the Dikwa type. Additionally, soil provided in camps and informal sites is expected to benefit 20 families per truck (2400 families in total, used as calculation for total number of beneficiaries assuming that a family consist of 6 members).
